refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkScale is a slider control used to select a numeric value. To use it, you'll probably want to investigate the methods on its base class, GtkRange, in addition to the methods for GtkScale itself. To set the value of a scale, you would normally use gtk_range_set_value(). To detect changes to the value, you would normally use the "value_changed" signal.
The GtkScale widget is an abstract class, used only for deriving the subclasses GtkHScale and GtkVScale. To create a scale widget, call gtk_hscale_new_with_range() or gtk_vscale_new_with_range().

refsect2.title: GtkScale
refsect2.para:
The GtkScale-struct struct contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)
guint draw_value; non-zero if the scale's current value is displayed next to the slider.
guint value_pos; the position in which the textual value is displayed, selected from GtkPositionType.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_set_digits ()
refsect2.para: Sets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the value. Also causes the value of the adjustment to be rounded off to this number of digits, so the retrieved value matches the value the user saw.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
the number of decimal places to display, e.g. use 1 to display 1.0, 2 to display 1.00 etc.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_set_draw_value ()
refsect2.para: Specifies whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
a boolean.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_set_value_pos ()
refsect2.para: Sets the position in which the current value is displayed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
the position in which the current value is displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_get_digits ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the value.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
the number of decimal places that are displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_get_draw_value ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
whether the current value is displayed as a string.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_get_value_pos ()
refsect2.para: Gets the position in which the current value is displayed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale.
the position in which the current value is displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_get_layout ()
refsect2.para: Gets the PangoLayout used to display the scale. The returned object is owned by the scale so does not need to be freed by the caller.

listitem.simpara: A GtkScale
the PangoLayout for this scale, or NULL if the draw_value property is FALSE.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_scale_get_layout_offsets ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the coordinates where the scale will draw the PangoLayout representing the text in the scale. Remember when using the PangoLayout function you need to convert to and from pixels using PANGO_PIXELS() or PANGO_SCALE.
If the draw_value property is FALSE, the return values are undefined.

listitem.simpara: a GtkScale
location to store X offset of layout, or NULL
location to store Y offset of layout, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "digits" property
refsect2.para: The number of decimal places that are displayed in the value.
Allowed values: [-1,64]
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "draw-value" property
refsect2.para: Whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "value-pos" property
refsect2.para: The position in which the current value is displayed.
Default value: GTK_POS_TOP

refsect2.title: The "slider-length" style property
refsect2.para: Length of scale's slider.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 31

refsect2.title: The "value-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: Space between value text and the slider/trough area.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 2
